availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. Hinds (Estill County, Kentucky, surveyor and soldier in the 14th KY Cav US)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, surveyor and soldier. Indiana native. Married to Sally Ann Tipton Hinds in Estill County, Kentucky, on March 22, 1842. Father of Samuel F. Hinds, Mary E. Hinds, Jessie T. Hinds, Sarah Hinds, and Faney B. Hinds. Farmer in Estill County in 1850. Surveyor in Estill County in 1860. Served in the Company F of the 14th Regiment Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A) as a private from February 13, 1863 to Mach 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 59A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 250.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0130.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Estill County Marriages, Film #000254628, p. 127.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application 190569, 305303, Certificate 233693.
